help-file.title: "GOD, PARTICIPATION"
help-file.content:
This refers to the level to participation each god is expected to contribute to the MUD. In order to obtain and maintain a god of some power here on Duris, each god is expected to continually contribute in some fashion.
The point the Forgers are trying to make is that it is a *privilege* to be a god here on Duris, not a right. Once you have earned your immortality, you are an example to all others below you, mortal or immortal, and there will always be others that, given the chance, would gladly take your position.
You are expected to contribute to the MUD in some fashion and on a regular basis. Unlike some MUDs, you cannot create one or two zones, earn a god, and ride on fame forever. We do NOT, however, mean that you have to work every day (or even every month), but *some* type of contribution from every god is necessary to keep Duris expanding and growing.
All gods will be assessed on a regular basis and assessments will be handled in this manner: --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Each month, during the Forgers' regular meeting, each god (including forgers) will be evaluated for the month based on what they have done or not done to contribute to the MUD. One month of inactivity is fine, even two, if you are busy, but *not* three. If you have a reason, such as school or something that inhibits you, fine. If you are having trouble to the extent that it will drastically affect your MUD contribution, inform the Forgers *immediately* and there will be no hassles whatsoever.
Bear in mind that gods with months of inactivity (without a plausible excuse) will be demoted to mortal status. There will always be other people who wish to work for Duris and help us out. Inactive gods can easily be replaced.
The god slots are limited. Thus, if you wish to keep your god, you will have to work for it like the rest of us (including Forgers).
Remember, it is a privilege to be a god here, not a right.
